titles.title: Contracting Out Appeals Reform Act of 1988

A bill to amend title 31, United States Code, to permit the Comptroller General of the United States to review and decide protests of Federal Government employees relating to converting to contractor performance certain functions performed by such employees.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.

bill.summary: 4/29/1988--Introduced. Contracting Out Appeals Reform Act of 1988 - Amends Federal law on the procurement protest system to permit the Comptroller General of the United States to review and decide protests of Federal Government employees relating to conversion to contractor performance of certain functions they perform.
